jobs.title: Backend PHP Developer (Symfony2)
jobs.description:
DESCRIPTION

We are currently building several products for LendInvest - the world's largest peer-to-peer (P2P) marketplace real estate mortgages. We are a loan originating beast as well as the lender. We're removing the middleman by enabling technology to help create a direct borrower to lender experience.

We are extending our current investor portal in Symfony2, creating products for a "Secondary Market" (people buying and selling loan investments), adding new products as well as working on APIs for third parties and many other projects in the pipeline. The work is predominately greenfield projects

Candidates must have strong recent hands-on Symfony2 experience as well as excellent knowledge of software engineering best practices, design patterns, etc. An interest in Devops is a plus, although we do have Devops/systems support available.

Our servers are on AWS, database is MySQL/Amazon RDS, we have CI with Jenkins and Travis, and we use Behat and PHPSpec. We operate in an Agile environment using Scrum methodology.

You must be eligible to work in the UK without visa/sponsorship.

REQUIREMENTS

4+ years PHP 5 Object Oriented experience including strong experience with an MVC PHP framework
2+ years using Symfony / Symfony2 (recent Symfony2 experience required)
Doctrine 2
MySQL
RESTful services
Version control using Git
Agile Scrum methodology experience
PHPSpec/TDD Behat/BDD
Self-reliant, creative problem solver, outcome orientated
Adaptive learner, someone who’s motivated by the challenge of getting things done, team player
Strong communication skills

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer - CSS3 / HTML5
jobs.description:
DESCRIPTION

LendInvest is one of the top FinTech companies in the UK, and the world's largest peer-to-peer (P2P) marketplace for real estate mortgages. We are a loan originating beast as well as the lender.

We are looking for a new member of our front-end development team. We use the de facto industry standard tools like Grunt, Gulp, Sass, jQuery, AngularJS to build our apps, and design and user experience are critical.

You should have 3 or or more years commercial experience as a front-end web developer. We believe that attitude is as important as experience. The ideal candidate shows energy and the will to learn and to improve themselves.

If you think you've already learned everything then please stop reading now.

We're looking for a coder, not a designer, but we would love to hire someone with ideas and opinions about UI/UX who will help us continually improve our products.

REQUIREMENTS

Required

A very good understand of HTML and HTML5;
A very good understanding of CSS and CSS3;
Good understanding of POJS (plain old javascript);
Working experience with jQuery, Underscore, lodash;
Understanding and experience of cross-browser issues;
Working experience designing an UX schema, starting from business requirements. Also with pen and paper;
Good taste in visual design (colors coupling, typography, spaces);
Think mobile first responsiveness; and

Nice to Have

Familiarity with Twig or a similar templating system (we use Twig)
Experience integrating with Symfony2 or other PHP applications
JavaScript Unit Testing (TDD/BDD - Jasmine, Karma, Mocha)
Experience with at least one major JavaScript framework (Angular.js, Backbone.js)
Working experience with Git, knowledge of bash or another shell
Some interest in NodeJs and the modern front-end workflow
Understanding of HTTP protocol
Experience in an Agile environment using SCRUM
Experience in Adobe Photoshop or Gimp
Experience in Adobe Illustrator
Love for technology
Love for design

jobs.title: Backend Engineer - Multiple roles at various levels
jobs.description:
What are we about?

LendInvest is a fast-growing and FinTech business that’s shaping the future of property finance. Since launching in 2008 (as Montello, we rebranded in 2013), our investors have invested in over £1 billion of loans to buy, build or renovate almost 4,000 properties around the UK. We’ve built a highly scalable business model and have secured £39 million equity investment to date from the likes of Atomico, the European venture capital fund led by Skype founder, Niklas Zennström.

LendInvest is the world’s largest online marketplace for property lending and investing, as well as one of the UK’s most exciting FinTech companies. In the last few months we’ve been named in the Sunday Times’ Disrupt 10, a list of the ten most disruptive businesses in the UK, and we debuted at #37 in the 2017 Sunday Times Tech Track 100.

What’s the team like?

We are using technology and innovation to make the process of owning and investing in property simple and straightforward. To date - we have loaned £1 billion, but we have set the bar much higher.

We hire people who are passionate about solving real-world problems in an exciting, dynamic, collaborative and fun environment.

Our engineering teams, split into cross functional teams that look after the investor and borrower platforms, provide the technology and innovation that allows us to grow and evolve as a business. Without them, we could not achieve the goals we set as a company. From building a brand new microservice architecture to introducing 3rd party services to enable efficiencies or expansion, the challenges are never ending.

We are always evolving and right now that evolution is happening in our cutting edge technology team. We want to hire engineers who are not only passionate about a particular technology but technology as a whole and how it fits into the overall picture of a highly scalable product.

We rely heavily on PHP7, Symfony3, MySQL and Node.JS, AWS, Docker and Kubernetes

What’s my day to day going to be like?

Take part in daily stand ups
Go through project boards to evaluate the work to be done
Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
Write unit and functional tests
Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
What we’d like you to have:

PHP7, Symfony3, MySQL, Node.JS (but don’t be put off if these aren’t your primary languages)
Good knowledge of Design Patterns
Good knowledge of REST
MySQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes would be a bonus
Test Driven (TDD). You will never say it’s ready until it’s been tested, documented and explained
You are collaborative and prefer to work as a team rather than as an individual


It would be great if you:

Have experience using DDD
Have an active interest in finance or property and industry disruption


What you’ll get in return:

Always be learning. We won’t ever expect you to do the same thing over and over. We want to give you new opportunities to become the best engineer you can be.
Make a measurable difference. We’re here to change the way the world deals with property by making it accessible for all.
A relaxed open-plan working environment
Matched pension contributions up to 4%
Discretionary share-option scheme
25 days holiday
Enhance maternity/paternity pay
Subsidised gym membership via PerkBox
Various other discounts/benefits via PerkBox
Open bar from 5.30pm (4pm on Fridays)
Cooked lunch on Friday's from a local restaurant
A selection of breakfast cereals and fresh fruits and snacks are available each day
A MacBook or similar and everything else you need to do your job and a great team all working towards a common goal.

Frontend Engineer - Various levels

What are we about

LendInvest is a fast-growth Financial Technology business that is shaping the future of property finance. Since launching in 2008, we’ve funded over £1 billion of loans to buy, build or renovate almost 4,000 properties around the UK. We raised almost £50 million of equity backing to date from top tier investors such as Atomico, the European venture capital fund led by Skype founder, Niklas Zennström. In total we’ve raised and manage over $1 billion of funds for investors.

LendInvest is the world’s largest online marketplace for property lending and investing, and is one of the UK’s fastest growing FinTech companies.


What’s the team like?

We are using technology and innovation to make the process of owning and investing in property simple and straightforward. To date - we have loaned £1 billion, but we have set the bar much higher.

We hire people who are passionate about solving real-world problems in an exciting, dynamic, collaborative and fun environment.

Our engineering teams, split into cross functional teams that look after the investor and borrower platforms, provide the technology and innovation that allows us to grow and evolve as a business. Without them, we could not achieve the goals we set as a company. From building a brand new microservice architecture to introducing 3rd party services to enable efficiencies or expansion, the challenges are never ending.

We are always evolving and right now that evolution is happening in our cutting edge technology team. We want to hire engineers who are not only passionate about a particular technology but technology as a whole and how it fits into the overall picture of a highly scalable product.

We rely heavily on React and Redux consuming RESTful APIs and on the backend, PHP7, Symfony3, Node.JS and MySQL. We use AWS, Docker and Kubernetes for infrastructure.


What’s my day to day going to be like?

* Create responsive website layout/user interface
* Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
* Create and maintain software documentation
* Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
* Cooperate with web designers to match visual design intent


What we need you to have?

* ES6 Javascript
* CSS
* Responsive design
* Confident in working with RESTIsh API
* You’re passionate about Interactive Design and you came across Atomic Design principles
* You are collaborative and prefer to work as a team rather than as an individual
* You have experience with one or more of the modern javascript frameworks (React, amber, angular, backbone)


It would be great if you've got the following:

* Worked on some highly scalable microservices,
* Experience of Test Driven Development (TDD)
* Any knowledge of Node.JS
* Knowledge of AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
* An interest in learning React and Redux
* Keen interest in finance or property and industry disruption


What you’ll get in return

* We work in cross functional teams and use Domain Driven Design (DDD) to understand our stakeholders and business to produce better outcomes. We use short iterations to provide value incrementally.

* Chance to always be learning. We won’t ever expect you to do the same thing over and over. We want to give you new opportunities to become the best engineer you can be.
* Private Healthcare (Vitality)
* Season Ticket Loan

* Make a measurable difference. We’re here to change the way the world deals with property finance by making it accessible for all.
* A relaxed open-plan working environment
* Matched pension contributions up to 4%
* Discretionary share-option scheme
* 25 days’ holiday
* Enhance maternity/paternity pay
* Subsidised gym membership via PerkBox
* Various other discounts/benefits via PerkBox

* Cooked lunch on Fridays from a local restaurant
* A selection of breakfast cereals and fresh fruits and snacks are available each day
* A MacBook or similar and everything else you need to do your job
* Great team all working towards a common goal.

jobs.title: QA Automation Engineer
jobs.description:
What are we about?

LendInvest is a fast-growth Financial Technology business that is shaping the future of property finance. Since launching in 2008, we’ve funded over £1 billion of loans to buy, build or renovate almost 4,000 properties around the UK. We raised almost £50 million of equity backing to date from top tier investors such as Atomico, the European venture capital fund led by Skype founder, Niklas Zennström. In total we’ve raised and manage over $1 billion of funds for investors.


LendInvest is the world’s largest online marketplace for property lending and investing, and is one of the UK’s fastest growing FinTech companies.


What’s the team like?

We are using technology and innovation to make the process of owning and investing in property simple and straightforward. To date - we have loaned £1 billion, but we have set the bar much higher.

As we continue to grow we are a looking for a QA Automation Engineer to join our growing engineering team. We hire people who are passionate about solving real-world problems in an exciting, dynamic, collaborative and fun environment.

This role sits across our delivery teams ensuring we release quality features and changes for our clients. The ideal candidate will have experience in QA/Testing and be skilled in automated testing design and implementation. You must be able to work successfully across Test, Development, Deployment, and Support. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and updating automated suites, and will be expected to contribute to the overall test strategy, execution, and QA procedures.

We hire people who are passionate about solving real-world problems in an exciting, dynamic, collaborative and fun environment.


Check out our awesome engineering careers page to find out what it's really like at LendInvest: https://www.lendinvest.com/careers/meet-the-teams/engineering/ (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lendinvest.com%2Fcareers%2Fmeet-the-teams%2Fengineering%2F)


What’s my day to day going to be like?

* Take part in daily stand ups
* Go through project boards to evaluate the work to be done
* Pick up tickets for test execution
* Analyse requirements/features to test
* Execute testing on multiple projects/products
* Discuss test requirements with product, UX and development teams
* Manage test environment and test data
* Execute automated test suite
* Evaluate where and how to increase/improve automation suite coverage
* Develop/Program automated test suites
* Assist product teams with Acceptance tasks
* Take part in features design/requirements discussions
* Help product and development teams define and structure features’ scope and its tasks
* Discuss and improve QA procedures/strategies with all parts


What we need you to have?

* Deep experience designing and executing automated, end-to-end integration tests in API-driven applications;
* Cucumber/Gherkin/Selenium;
* Programming/scripting test automation suites (preferably using OOP languages like Java);
* Experience writing comprehensive software test plans;
* Ability to learn and understand new features, and work with business analysts and product folks to understand new requirements;

jobs.description:
Senior Front-end Engineer

What are we about?

LendInvest is a fast-growth Financial Technology business that is shaping the future of property finance. Since launching in 2008, we’ve funded over £1 billion of loans to buy, build or renovate almost 4,000 properties around the UK. We raised almost £50 million of equity backing to date from top tier investors such as Atomico, the European venture capital fund led by Skype founder, Niklas Zennström. In total we’ve raised and manage over $1 billion of funds for investors.


LendInvest is the world’s largest online marketplace for property lending and investing, and is one of the UK’s fastest growing FinTech companies.


What’s the team like?

We are using technology and innovation to make the process of owning and investing in property simple and straightforward. To date - we have loaned £1 billion, but we have set the bar much higher.

We hire people who are passionate about solving real-world problems in an exciting, dynamic, collaborative and fun environment.

Our engineering teams, split into cross functional teams that look after the investor, loan engine and borrower platforms, providing the technology and innovation that allows us to grow and evolve as a business. Without them, we could not achieve the goals we set as a company. From building a brand new microservices architecture to introducing 3rd party services to enable efficiencies or expansion, the challenges are never ending.

We rely heavily on React and Redux consuming RESTful APIs built using PHP7, Symfony3, Node.JS and MySQL. We use AWS, Docker and Kubernetes for infrastructure.

Requirements

What you'll be doing

* Build frameworks and processes to accomplish technical excellency across all Front-end projects
* Mentoring more junior members of the team with a variety of techniques including explaining advanced technical techniques and pair programming.
* Take complex requirements and confidently design and implement solutions

* Create responsive website layout/user interface
* Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
* Create and maintain software documentation
* Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
* Cooperate with web designers to match visual design intent

What we need you to have?

* ES8 JavaScript
* CSS & Sass or other preprocessing engine
* Confidence in working with RESTIsh APIs
* Experience with modelling the Front-end architecture
* You’re passionate about building products offering effective User Experience You are collaborative and prefer to work as a team rather than as an individual
* You have experience with ReactJS, Redux stack

It would be great if you've got the following:

* As a senior developer you will have strong and deep technical knowledge across most (but not necessarily) all of the above technical areas.
* Worked on some highly scalable microservices,
* Understanding of Test Driven Development (TDD)
* Knowledge of Node.JS
* Knowledge of AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
* Keen interest in finance or property and industry disruption
* You came across Atomic Design principles
* Knowledge of any functional language or experience with functional patterns

Benefits

What you’ll get in return

* Ability to change ways of working, lots of appreciation from colleagues, exposure to the business
* We work in cross functional teams and use Domain Driven Design (DDD) to understand our stakeholders and business to produce better outcomes. We use short iterations to provide value incrementally.

* Chance to always be learning. We won’t ever expect you to do the same thing over and over. We want to give you new opportunities to become the best engineer you can be.

* Make a measurable difference. We’re here to change the way the world deals with property finance by making it accessible for all.
* A relaxed open-plan working environment
* Private Healthcare (Vitality)
* Season Ticket Loan
* Matched pension contributions up to 4%
* Discretionary share-option scheme
* 25 days’ holiday
* Enhance maternity/paternity pay
* Various discounts/benefits via PerkBox (Including Gym, food and cinema)
* Open bar from 5.30pm (4pm on Fridays)
* Cooked lunch on Fridays from a local restaurant
* A selection of breakfast cereals and fresh fruits and snacks are available each day
* A MacBook or similar and everything else you need to do your job
* Great team all working towards a common goal.
